instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that does not turn on, no signs of visible damage. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and coils?

Remove F7000 and check <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
"L7410 0.001
L7420 .0L
L7430 .0L"
Are you sure?
All these coils are tied together.

Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages: <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
L7420, L7430  also 0.001 sorry, was making a bad contact.

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.0v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> = 5.21v

<SIGNAL>TBA_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 1.3v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> = 0.6V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> = 0.6V
<SIGNAL>SMC_AUX_OK</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
What about  <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>  (<SIGNAL>SMC_4FINGERS_RST</SIGNAL>)???

Also check diode mode to ground at VDDA/P.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_4FINGERS_RST</SIGNAL> = 0V

Diode Mode
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> 0.028
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> 0.029

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Looks like bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

Just in case, remove <CAPACITOR>C7075</CAPACITOR>/7 first.
If still low readings, change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
removed <CAPACITOR>C7075</CAPACITOR>/7 no change. 

I realized there's a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>, even after taking  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> out

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Yeah, that's other problem.
You shouldn't have 0.028 anymore on VDDA/P.

You can try to find the short on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> using voltage injection method.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Replaced  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 

there was a short on CB300, replaced now got 3.3v on  <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 

Still no turn on.

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> = 19v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> = 20v 


<SIGNAL>TBA_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 4.97v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_L</SIGNAL> = erratic between 0v and 2.3 v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> =0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_AUX_OK</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_4FINGERS_RST</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at VDDA/P.
If no short, resolder/replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
I replaced the chip again:

<SIGNAL>TBA_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 4.97v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> = 5.0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> = 5.0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_AUX_OK</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_4FINGERS_RST</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message: Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message: No,  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  is now 0.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> level.
Test if board turns on in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_USBC_INT_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

No turn on with SMC Bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message: Remove F7000 and check again <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> is 0v with F7000 disconnected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
Check resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
Also check diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>.

Are you sure <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has good solders?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no turn on.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 resistance is 2.6 ohms for both

diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> is 0.500

It is possible  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>  has gone bad from so much heat, ill have to wait for another one to arrive.
